postgresql_postgresql_schema.description: Creates and manages a schema within a PostgreSQL database.

name.description: The name of the schema. Must be unique in the PostgreSQL

database.description: The DATABASE in which where this schema will be created. (Default: The database used by your `provider` configuration)

owner.description: The ROLE who owns the schema.

if_not_exists.description: When true, use the existing schema if it exists. (Default: true)

drop_cascade.description: When true, will also drop all the objects that are contained in the schema. (Default: false)

policy.description: Can be specified multiple times for each policy.  Each

create.description: Should the specified ROLE have CREATE privileges to the specified SCHEMA.

create_with_grant.description: Should the specified ROLE have CREATE privileges to the specified SCHEMA and the ability to GRANT the CREATE privilege to other ROLEs.

role.description: The ROLE who is receiving the policy.  If this value is empty or not specified it implies the policy is referring to the [`PUBLIC` role](https://www.postgresql.org/docs/current/static/sql-grant.html).

usage_with_grant.description: Should the specified ROLE have USAGE privileges to the specified SCHEMA and the ability to GRANT the USAGE privilege to other ROLEs.
